channel.title: Tricks on Cooking
channel.description: Recent content in Tricks on Cooking

item.title: Cooking Item: Poached Egg Cups
item.description: Bought these during one of Amazon’s Cyber Monday deals. They work good for me and can be used in an Instant Pot too. However, I stopped using the Instant Pot with them, because it is hard to dial in the doneness and it is way overkill to use a pressure cooking poached eggs anyways. Now, with the whole egg still in the shell pressure cookers are great for soft and hard boiled eggs.

item.title: Cooking Item: Vacuum Sealer
item.description: Great for sous vide Makes buying in bulk from Costco better and of course sous vide was my primary driver for getting one.

item.title: Pressure / Smoking Item: Claws
item.description: Claws to shred meat easily These things are great. I used a blender a couple of times to make shredded chicken (you can Google it), but it makes a mess. Little pieces always shot all over the place. These are fast and easy to clean.

item.title: Pressure Cooking Item: Extra Pot
item.description: Extra Pot Having an extra pot speeds to cooking multiple items at a time.

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Apps
item.description: Two Necessary Apps For Your Phone Download and install: Joule (if you have a Joule you don’t have a choice on this one). Anova. Both apps work without the device, so you can read through their recipes and techniques.

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Cast Iron
item.description: Cast Iron For Searing Bought two cast iron skillets to sear. These both are made by Lodge and heavy. I seasoned them three times at 400 degrees for an hour each time. * Photo

item.title: Sous Vide Item: ChefSteps Joule Cooker
item.description: Joule Cooker This in the only one I’ve ever owned, so I can’t comment on others. So far, so good though. Performance 1100 watts heating power Temperature accuracy 0.2 째F / 0.1 째C Maximum water temperature 208 째F (98 째C) Maximum bath volume 10+ gallons Article

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Ping Pong Balls?
item.description: Ping Pong Balls To Retain Heat Went to the Dollar Tree near my house and bought 8 packages of 6 balls. These trap the water from evaporating on long cooks. It has been extremely effective. * Photo

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Plastic Container
item.description: Plastic Sous Vide Container Used a metal pot for a while, but broke down and bought one of these to make my setup more effecient. Metal transfers heat, so the sous vide machine has to do more heating as a result.

item.title: Sous Vide Item: Upright Bag Holder
item.description: No fighting to keep the bag open while attempting to fill it with food Worth it. Especially, if you are buying in bulk from somewhere like Costco like I do.

item.title: The Original Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner
item.description: Chainmail Scrubber This thing works great on quickly cleaning stainless steel and cast iron. Careful with how much pressure you put or you’ll scratch and/or remove the seasoning on the pan. In some of my sous vide pictures you can see that I also use it to weigh down food that wants to float to the top.
